intro: Ainsliaea macroclinidioides, commonly known as the broad-leaf ainsliaea, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, particularly Mexico and Central America. The plant is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Ainsliaea macroclinidioides is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
